Pre-Game Insights: Host country Germany will face Denmark at Dortmund’s Westfalenstadion on Saturday, June 29, 2024, at 21:00 CET, 19:00 GMT.
Julian Nagelsmann’s side won Group A with seven points, sending runners-up Switzerland to the other side of the draw, where they’ll cross paths with Luciano Spalletti’s Italy.
Denmark finished second in Group C, level on three points with Slovenia, but with a better disciplinary record.
Others: Tickets for Germany vs Denmark are available through the UEFA ticket portal, with prices ranging from €50 to €500.
Fans in the US can watch the match on fuboTV or ViX+, while English-speaking countries like the UK can use BBC iPlayer and ITVX.
Germany's confirmed squad includes notable players such as Manuel Neuer, Joshua Kimmich, and Thomas Müller.
Denmark's confirmed squad includes notable players such as Kasper Schmeichel, Christian Eriksen, and Rasmus Højlund.
